title: FS: N172 Old Judge Toole SGC 30
author: vintagetoppsguy

posts.post_title: FS: N172 Old Judge Toole SGC 30
posts.post_content:
For sale 1887 Old Judge Toole SGC 30.  Let me preface this by saying I hate those "make offer" listings, but I really have no idea to ask for this card so I am looking for offers.  I obtained this card in a trade with a fellow board member about a month ago and I know what I had to give in trade, so I am looking for an offer in that ballpark.  I'm not necessarily looking for the best offer, just a fair offer.  In other words, I am not going to hold out and wait for the highest offer - I will sell the card to the first offer that I feel is reasonable.  Here are the scans.  Thanks for looking.  

[IMG]http://i185.photobucket.com/albums/x137/vintagetoppsguy/Pre-War%20Cards/1887OJN172TooleFront.jpg[/IMG][IMG]http://i185.photobucket.com/albums/x137/vintagetoppsguy/Pre-War%20Cards/1887OJN172TooleBack.jpg[/IMG]

I will make it a crisp 100.00 bill for the card.

Don Miller                  email  [url]rellim@abe.midco.net[/url]

posts.post_title: Making an offer for the card!!!
posts.post_content:
David,
  I believe there has been some confusion about my offer for the card. I guess my wording left some to believe that the card was for sale for 100.00. I have gotten emails offering to buy the card. My original response to your listing was to make an offer of 100.00 for the card. I was hoping you would either accept or reject the offer. 100.00 was not the owner listing a selling price.Hope that cleared up the confusion. 

Don Miller

PS My original offer of 100.00 for the card still stands.   [url]Rellim@abe.midco.net[/url]


























2

Don,

Hello!  Thank you for the offer.  I obtained the card in a trade with a fellow board member and unfortunately your offer is quite less than what I have into it, so I will have to pass.  However, the card has been moved to eBay and you are more than welcome to bid on it.  Good luck!

David

It sucks not knowing what your stuff is worth :(

I'm in the same boat with T205's - you can either figure it out and post prices, knowing you're likely to take a hit due to your lack of knowledge, or you can let the market decide for you on ebay.  Sounds like you made the right decision.
I'd guess it's worth around $200 maybe a little more.
